summary: Timer creation fails with "BadStartTimerAttributes" error when StartToFireTimeout is not properly set on the timer command, causing workers to crash with an unhandled gRPC error.
userImpact: Users encounter worker crashes when using timers without proper timeout configuration, with an unclear error message.
rootCause: StartToFireTimeout attribute is not being validated or set correctly when creating timer commands.
resolutionDetails: Issue was addressed through proper validation and error handling in timer command creation.
keyQuote: BadStartTimerAttributes: A valid StartToFireTimeout is not set on command.
